intro: Alaternoides, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its milky sap, which is toxic and can cause skin irritation. The plants typically have simple, alternate leaves and produce small, inconspicuous flowers. Alaternoides species are often shrubs or small trees, adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. They are valued for their ornamental appeal and have been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
